title: Scrum Studio
description: Although not officially a program it was presenting in Kens book Software in 30 Days and adopted by KLM and other companies. There was one test class in 2013 but it was never taken forward. Its based around creating a pocket of agile, having that grow with demand and the rest of the organisation shrink.

title: The Agility Guide to Evidence-Based Change
description: The Agility Guide contains the definition of Evidence-Based Change, a publicly available framework for managing change to improve outcomes, reduce risk and optimize investment. Evidence-Based Change is developed and sustained by Ken Schwaber and Scrum.org.

title: Agility Path
description: Agility Path was a software and framework using evidence-based metrics to drive organisational change and improve agility through regular inspection of value delivery.

title: Evidence-Based Management Consultant
description: An early consultant-level accreditation programme to help organisations improve outcomes using evidence-based metrics before EBM was formalised.

title: Scrum Development Kit (SDK)
description: The Scrum Development Kit was intended to provide detailed technical definitions of 'Done' and engineering practices for Scrum teams across technology stacks.

title: Partners in Principle
description: Partners in Principle recognised organisations that exemplified Scrum.org's ethos and supported the improvement of the profession of software delivery.

title: Professional Scrum Guided Learning Platform (GLP)
description: The Guided Learning Platform is a Scrum.org platform that provides structured learning paths and resources for Scrum practitioners.

title: Advanced Professional Scrum Master (APSM)
description: The working title of the program to assess the working proficiency of a Scrum Master without ever having met them. Not to be confised with the PSM-A class for Scrum Masters.

title: Professional Scrum Expert
description: In 2015, there was a post on Scrum.org that a new certification PSE is coming up. As of June 2016, Scrum.org has no official information on PSE

title: Professional Scrum Coaching
description: Professional Scrum Coaching original idea was a simple one. Add people into our community that are not trainers, but instead Scrum Coaches (people working with teams and organizations implementing Scrum on a daily basis).
